SENT.plain: Perforating benign ulcer is a very rare complication of Barrett's esophagus
This report presents the management of a patient with a Barrett's ulcer that penetrated into the left mainstem bronchus resulting in a life-threatening bronchial esophageal fistula

This rare complication was successfully managed by using a staged surgical approach, which combined the principles used for treating benign esophagorespiratory fistulas and perforating Barrett's ulcers
